title: Major Rework: opinions please!
content:
Fortunately I finally had the time to continue my first efforts in the conception of a spurless geometric sans.  
Any comments would be appreciated! :)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317152554im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Vincero%20Test2-01_3624.jpg)
author: Xenakis

comments.content:
The "a" looks too cyrillic.

I really like the rest.

That preview is pretty small, but:

I like the "a" of itself, but it doesn't fit.

The descenders are too long.

If the "J" descends the "Q" should definitely do the same!

hhp

Then I rather chose to let them both NOT descend. ;)  
But in general that's a good point about the descenders - I'll try to solve that.  
Here is a larger preview with alternative "r" and "a" I may have dismissed to early...  
 [Preview PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317152554/http:/www.davidmeurer.de/vincero_2.pdf)

Do you think that's a better "a"?  
Shortened the descenders as well... :)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317152554im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ag_6585.jpg)

Not sure about the "a". But the rest is all improvement.

hhp
